C8FCF0008EE4423DA3B962101E65CB6F.description: Use words and phrases acquired through conversations, reading and being read to, and responding to texts.

EB3EE2B686144D73ACF0BFF023B07CAC.description: Distinguish shades of meaning among verbs describing the same general action (e.g., walk, march, strut, prance) by acting out the meanings.

A70185D707154A39A1EA8A26FD7D6106.description: Identify real-life connections between words and their use (e.g., note places at school that are colorful).

71920BD816E740DD95AD619DFEE89F9B.description: Demonstrate understanding of frequently occurring verbs and adjectives by relating them to their antonyms.

CA1CDF4373C74CCAAA8F242388FA6216.description: Sort common objects into categories (e.g., shapes, foods) to gain a sense of the concepts the categories represent.

E774FE9EDEC04170ACFA9B38A90A141F.description: With guidance and support from adults, explore word relationships and nuances in word meanings.

5882E02FE87840AB8B6458A732EBEA68.description: Capitalize the first word in a sentence and the pronoun I.

F64EFA08DF524083929AE52AD6EFC7E4.description: Demonstrate command of the conventions of Standard English capitalization, punctuation, and spelling when writing.

640CE3A2D4894C838B4D212445EFF22D.description: Produce and expand complete sentences in shared language activities.

E21BE9A312C44AAA8C9180DF1B37D7A5.description: Use the most frequently occurring prepositions (e.g., to, from, in, out, on, off, for, of, by, with).

7B6995FB48274F91BA36DA2A94619614.description: Understand and use question words (interrogatives) (e.g., who, what, where, when, why, how).

C64E047A3F5249B0AC0ACB3EA9F5CD67.description: Form regular plural nouns orally by adding /s/ or /es/ (e.g., dog, dogs; wish, wishes).

1C731FC04B1346358FCCA0B4FD976F65.description: Use frequently occurring nouns and verbs.

8CE1A7E49F1E4E6AB586D674BA67AB3D.description: Demonstrate command of the conventions of Standard English grammar and usage when writing or speaking.

1C9A7BA0B9104ACE9E13F5E17E49A51C.description: Speak audibly and express thoughts, feelings, and ideas clearly.

59BC418BD8A94333AC078B86D759B579.description: Add drawings or other visual displays to descriptions as desired to provide additional detail.

B24CE8DD525049FB8D706716D3AC841F.description: Describe familiar people, places, things, and events and, with prompting and support, provide additional detail.

E1DCE1A14BC4436FB1B6F814CF022BE6.description: Ask and answer questions in order to seek help, get information, or clarify something that is not understood.

DE6CEE68AC2B480BAA6CFAF0029B8B71.description: Confirm understanding of a text read aloud or information presented orally or through other media by asking and answering questions about key details and requesting clarification if something is not understood.

EE23F97AC71641099C21D386508CDE15.description: Continue a conversation through multiple exchanges.

BC1812C46931463AABB3316D1961DF1A.description: Follow agreed-upon rules for discussions (e.g., listening to others, taking turns speaking about the topics and texts under discussion).

76FA9812B81348B5963F619AD08B6679.description: Participate in collaborative conversations with diverse partners about kindergarten topics and texts with peers and adults in small and larger groups.

6CE175B91D974B99BD3659B2E89C564B.description: Attempt phonetic spelling of unknown words.

80C4C369D69C44A0A0E5E74031D7F6D3.description: Accurately write grade-level appropriate words, as found in a research-based word list.

636531FA6EBC45A0B6B9A378668F1B11.description: Spell VC (Vowel-Consonant) (e.g., at, in) and CVC (Consonant-Vowel-Consonant) (e.g., pet, mud) words with short vowel sounds.

CF2DF55C24C641C0806C9B336E0C5701.description: Write or select an initial or final consonant when a medial vowel is provided.

FCAA8749B9FC4813BA71E456871A0AD3.description: Represent phonemes in simple words, using letter-sound relationships.

A6C5D45B57CE4E4F99E1B714ABC13AB6.description: Know and apply phonics and word analysis skills when encoding words.

12EF7DC3B9E04704BB6ED0FDDBFD0907.description: Write the letters used to represent vowel phonemes and those used to represent consonants, knowing that every syllable has a vowel.

5C7C871B3AC144029170768AA690DE83.description: Segment all the phonemes in two and three-phoneme syllables and represent those phonemes with letters.

4887C4B6CB89450EB697C4ABA41E2C41.description: Write left to right using appropriate spacing between words.

F94175C6931D496AA657F4BA3F208E36.description: Write upper and lower manuscript letters, with reference to a model.

F69A1488FA5447F689EBD19A0F0C67A2.description: Match upper and lower case manuscript letters.

0FEF3FE56A5B45B593F824B8003D3DAF.description: With guidance and support from adults, recall information from experiences or gather information from provided sources to answer a question.

952D56B909424AEF8F0B8B0A077EAD0B.description: With guidance and support from adults, participate in shared research and writing projects (e.g., explore a number of books by a favorite author and express opinions about them).

496F83589E6D4A05A6E6D25636B2EF5D.description: Research to Build and Present Knowledge

AA61FE5E6520462CBA3473546DE1C193.description: With guidance and support from adults, explore a variety of digital tools to produce and publish writing, including in collaboration with peers.

907D82CB603D4C9E8C0FDDA367543037.description: With guidance and support from adults, respond to questions and suggestions from peers and add details to strengthen writing as needed.

84AF719BA0DC4238A5E11DCF179B4E5C.description: With guidance and support from adults, produce writing in which the development and organization are appropriate to task and purpose. (Grade-specific expectations for writing types are defined in standards 1–3 above).

19C65B6771424C33A0FC00D85009735F.description: With guidance and support from adults, use a combination of drawing, dictating, and writing to narrate a single event or several loosely linked events, tell about the events in the order in which they occurred, and provide a reaction to what happened.

230F9E2E8D10414ABA810A3B6FCDFFBA.description: With guidance and support from adults, use a combination of drawing, dictating, and writing to compose informative/explanatory texts in which they name what they are writing about and supply some information about the topic.

FF4519435A4742C7893A296B1DE38F16.description: With guidance and support from adults, use a combination of drawing, dictating, and writing to compose opinion pieces in which they tell a reader the topic or the name of the book they are writing about and state an opinion or preference about the topic or book (e.g., My favorite book is…).

77D8D790BB0E4BC9A492BF5A89C27163.description: Read emergent-reader texts with purpose and understanding.

16E262D9CBAC47E6AC2423D6AE313E4F.description: Distinguish between similarly spelled words by identifying the sounds of the letters that differ.

21ACF3127E1C4A83B6CB4DC2B82B5356.description: Read 50 common high-frequency words by sight from a research-based word list.

4F6A92D7E6F243A886DC8B130A7B93A4.description: Demonstrate basic knowledge of one-to-one letter-sound correspondence by producing the primary or most frequent sound(s) for each consonant and the five major vowels.

8032BA96C8F942F09E9A9E950C2A2469.description: Know and apply phonics and word analysis skills in decoding words.

8639B4B9FD40406789C15A2382B4D7A1.description: Add, substitute, and delete individual phonemes in simple, one-syllable words to make new words.

5451E6B14293421EA3CE020ABFB4946D.description: Isolate and pronounce the initial, medial vowel (long and short vowels), and final sounds (phonemes) in three-phoneme words. (This does not include CVCs (Consonant-Vowel-Consonant) ending with /l/, /r/, or /x/.)

FB9BF876D1A444299B591AC6264E0D3D.description: Count, pronounce, blend, and segment syllables in spoken words. Blend and segment onsets and rimes of single-syllable spoken words. Blend spoken phonemes to form one-syllable words (e.g., /m/ /a/ /n/).

5A827BA526DE4838AF915650CDC0F024.description: Identify and produce sounds (phonemes) in a spoken word.

397E926C62184BC1802973EFBEDA1758.description: Demonstrate understanding of spoken words, syllables, and sounds (phonemes).

02276F118F7E4DADA7553326A1F60991.description: Recognize and name all upper and lowercase letters of the alphabet.

4460DEFC916446389920F5C3209CBFB9.description: Understand that words are separated by spaces in print.

D5E07E85CDF44EE99A61408F9D05612A.description: Recognize the difference between a letter and a printed word.

947FBBA958AB410B864468B4EBE8A4DE.description: Identify that a sentence is made up of a group of words.

915AD82A112345418543F052242687EF.description: Recognize that spoken words are represented in written language by specific sequences of letters.

D232A2F117E144A88C22CB8300A23625.description: Follow words from left to right, top to bottom, and page by page.

477C6F4437D64ABABEAA1ADF7F5DE687.description: Demonstrate understanding of the organization and basic features of print.

D14DA7457E8647AE920F93DB557E8381.description: With prompting and support, actively engage in group reading activities with purpose and understanding.

1D74E4B7CA4B41409E437DEEC3EDB5FE.description: Range of Reading and Level of Text Complexity

040212F394354BB3A6D4A2C57B0C1DE4.description: With prompting and support, identify basic similarities in and differences between two texts on the same topic (e.g., in illustrations, descriptions, or procedures).

59E1C337A23743B38A79656200053F56.description: With prompting and support, identify the reasons an author gives to support points in a text.

073338FA6A294CABB800B0FC202FDCF7.description: With prompting and support, describe the relationship between illustrations and the text in which they appear (e.g., what person, place, thing, or idea in the text an illustration depicts).

CF07FDF133F64689A55F949CFA5750B4.description: With prompting and support, name the author and illustrator of a text and define the role of each in presenting the ideas or information in a text.

9D2623CA65DA4D1D8E6E6BB08D4E6338.description: Recognize common types of informational text; identify the front cover, back cover, and title page of a book.

1B981AC49F13496285C7B26DCFCE224A.description: With prompting and support, ask and answer questions about unknown words in a text.

EF59096ECA55491D851011355EC26584.description: With prompting and support, describe the connection between two individuals, events, ideas, or pieces of information in a text.

68B2B0736FA94CA68B91DEFFA74862B4.description: With prompting and support, identify the main topic and retell key details of a text.

12B461A60C5D42508E0F954D5CCE5D38.description: With prompting and support, ask and answer questions about key details in a text.

9B4CF026F7E04ED193567CE7FF9A3C80.description: With prompting and support, actively engage in group reading activities with purpose and understanding.

B9D9BC99116B4D4C9BFBB885F3EE70BE.description: Range of Reading and Level of Text Complexity

85586BB5810D437A9AF09E873A11A601.description: With prompting and support, compare and contrast the adventures and experiences of characters in familiar stories.

F0529358CE614BE5A9314ACE8AD41DAA.description: With prompting and support, describe the relationship between illustrations and the story in which they appear (e.g., what moment in a story an illustration depicts).

BADD20873096400899908AC435E1F944.description: With prompting and support, name the author and illustrator of a story and define the role of each in telling the story.

ACD39248F5904028B85DBE7D0FBBF690.description: Recognize common types of texts (e.g., storybooks, poems); identify the front cover, back cover, and title of a book.

6B61A21AD4584522B2AE3812701733E1.description: With prompting and support, ask and answer questions about unknown words in a text.

E97CB9796D904D5D9405550262299BFB.description: With prompting and support, identify characters, settings, and major events in a story.

B18E9EDA6911465088D5B4B487F13B18.description: With prompting and support, retell familiar stories, including key details.

2D1D703B57E54B9FA573B39796B1E34D.description: With prompting and support, ask and answer questions about key details in a text.
